Subsubsection Text: Parent (and/or one of its affiliates) and an affiliate of Platinum have entered into a corporate advisory services agreement pursuant to which an affiliate of Platinum provides certain corporate advisory services to Parent and its subsidiaries until the agreement is terminated by the parties’ mutual written consent. In consideration for the provision of these services, Parent will pay an affiliate of Platinum an advisory fee of up to $15 million per year. Platinum may also provide other advisory services to Parent from time to time for which it may be paid a fee. Parent will also reimburse Platinum for its reasonable out-of-pocket costs and expenses incurred in connection with its services under the agreement. The agreement contains customary indemnification provisions in favor of an affiliate of Platinum. 209 -----

Section Title: MANAGEMENT’S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS OF DIVERSEY
Subsubsection Text: _This management discussion and analysis (“MD&A”) provides information we believe is useful in understanding our operating results, cash flows and financial condition. We provide quantitative and qualitative information about key drivers behind revenue and earnings performance, including the impact of foreign currency, acquisitions as well as changes in volume and pricing. The MD&A should be read together with our unaudited interim consolidated financial information for the three months ended March 31, 2023 and March 31, 2022 and with our audited consolidated financial statements and related notes as of and for the years ended December 31, 2022 and December 31, 2021, in each case, included elsewhere in this offering memorandum, which are prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (“U.S. GAAP”) (the “Diversey Consolidated Financial Statements”). The statements in this MD&A regarding industry outlook, our expectations regarding our future performance, liquidity and capital resources and other non-historical statements are forward-looking statements. These forward-looking statements are subject to numerous risks and uncertainties, including, but not limited to, the risks and uncertainties described in the “Risk Factors” and in the “Cautionary Statement Regarding Forward-Looking Information.” Our actual results may differ materially from those contained in or implied by any forward-looking statements. Unless otherwise indicated, references in this section to “we,” “us,” and “our,” refer to Diversey and its consolidated subsidiaries._

On the Solenis Acquisition Closing Date, we entered into our ABL Revolving Credit Facility. Our ABL Revolving Credit Facility is available to the Issuer and certain of its affiliates that are designated as co-borrowers therein and provide for senior secured asset-based, multi-currency revolving loans, swingline loans and letter of credit availability in an aggregate principal amount of up to $500.0 million (“Existing Revolver Amount”), subject to borrowing base capacity. Letters of credit are limited to the lesser of (a) $75.0 million and (b) the aggregate unused amount of commitments under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility then in effect, subject to borrowing base capacity. Bank of America, N.A. acts as administrative agent and collateral agent for our ABL Revolving Credit Facility. Our ABL Revolving Credit Facility matures five years after the Solenis Acquisition Closing Date. We use borrowings under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility for working capital and general corporate purposes and borrowings and issuances of letters of credit. On the Acquisition Closing Date, we intend to enter into an amendment to our ABL Revolving Credit Facility, which, among other things, will provide for an increase to the Existing Revolver Amount by $200.0 million (the “ABL Facility Increase”) to an aggregate principal amount of commitments of $700.0 million, subject to borrowing base capacity. We do not expect to borrow under the ABL Revolving Credit Facility on the Acquisition Closing Date. The loans made pursuant to the ABL Facility Increase will also mature five years after the Solenis Acquisition Closing Date and will be subject to the same terms and conditions as the existing ABL Revolving Credit Facility. Borrowings under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility are limited by borrowing base calculations based on the sum of specified percentages of eligible accounts receivable, eligible inventory and unrestricted cash, minus the amount of any applicable reserves. Borrowings bear interest at a floating rate, which can be either an adjusted Term SOFR rate (including a credit spread adjustment) plus an applicable margin or, at our option, a base rate plus an applicable margin. We may borrow on the ABL Revolving Credit Facility only up to the lesser of (i) the level of our then-current borrowing base and (ii) our committed maximum borrowing capacity. Subject to certain conditions, our ABL Revolving Credit Facility may be expanded by up to the greater of (a) the greater of (i) $250.0 million and (ii) 45% of Consolidated EBITDA (as such term is defined in the ABL Credit Agreement) of Parent and its restricted subsidiaries for the most recent twelve-month period and (b) the excess of the borrowing base at such time over the aggregate commitments under the ABL Revolving Credit Facility at such time. Our ability to draw under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility or issue letters of credit thereunder is conditioned upon, among other things, our delivery of prior written notice of a borrowing or letter of credit request, as applicable, our ability to reaffirm the representations and warranties contained in the ABL Credit Agreement in all material respects and the absence of any default or event of default thereunder. Our obligations under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility are guaranteed by Parent and its direct and indirect wholly-owned U.S. subsidiaries (subject to certain permitted exceptions, including exceptions based on immateriality thresholds of aggregate assets and revenues of excluded U.S. subsidiaries) as well as certain of Parent’s direct and indirect wholly-owned foreign subsidiaries organized in jurisdictions where borrowing base assets are located (subject to certain permitted exceptions; provided that no foreign subsidiary guarantees any obligations of any U.S. entity). As detailed in the immediately succeeding sentence, our ABL Revolving Credit Facility is secured by a lien on substantially all of Parent’s, the Issuer’s and each of their direct and indirect whollyowned U.S. subsidiaries’ current and fixed assets (subject to certain exceptions), as well as certain assets of certain of their direct and indirect wholly-owned foreign subsidiaries; provided that no foreign assets secure any obligations of any U.S. entity. Our ABL Revolving Credit Facility has a first-priority lien on the Current Asset Collateral (as such term is defined in the ABL Credit Agreement) and a second-priority lien on the Fixed Asset Collateral (as such term is defined in the ABL Credit Agreement) (second in priority to the liens securing our Term Loan Facility and Existing Secured Notes discussed below), in each case, subject to other permitted liens. The following fees are applicable under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility: (a) an unused line fee of (i) 0.375% per annum of the unused portion of our ABL Revolving Credit Facility (excluding any swingline loans) when the average daily unused portion of such facility is less than 50% of the aggregate commitments under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility or (ii) 0.250% per annum of the unused portion of our ABL Revolving Credit 210 ----- Facility when the average daily unused portion of such facility (excluding any swingline loans) is equal to or greater than 50% of the aggregate commitments under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility, (b) letter of credit fees of (i) a participation fee equal to the applicable margin for adjusted Term SOFR rate loans, as applicable, in each case, on the undrawn amount of all outstanding letters of credit under the ABL Revolving Credit Facility and (ii) a fronting fee equal to 0.125% on the average daily amount of undrawn and unreimbursed letters of credit per annum and (c) certain other customary fees and expenses of the lenders, letter of credit issuers and agents thereunder. Subject to customary provisions for discretionary and protective over-advances, we are required to make prepayments under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility at any time when, and to the extent that, the aggregate amount of the outstanding loans and letters of credit under our ABL Revolving Credit Facility exceeds the then applicable borrowing base. Our ABL Revolving Credit Facility contains customary covenants, including, but not limited to, restrictions on our ability and that of our restricted subsidiaries to merge and consolidate with other companies, incur indebtedness, grant liens or security interests on assets, make acquisitions, loans, advances or investments, pay dividends, sell or otherwise transfer assets, optionally prepay or modify terms of certain junior indebtedness, enter into transactions with affiliates or certain burdensome agreements, modify our governing documents or certain junior debt documents or change our line of business. Our ABL Revolving Credit Facility requires the maintenance of a minimum Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio (as set forth in the ABL Credit Agreement) of 1.00 to 1.00 (tested for the four fiscal quarter period ending on the last day of the most recently ended fiscal quarter for which financials have been delivered, and at the end of each succeeding fiscal quarter thereafter) during any period commencing on the date when Adjusted Availability (as such term is defined in the ABL Credit Agreement) is less than the greater of (a) 10% of the Line Cap (as such term is defined in the ABL Credit Agreement) and (b) $25.0 million and ending on the date on which Adjusted Availability has exceeded the greater of (a) 10% of the Line Cap and (b) $25.0 million for at least 30 consecutive calendar days. Our ABL Revolving Credit Facility provides that, upon the occurrence of certain events of default, our obligations thereunder may be accelerated and the lending commitments terminated. Such events of default include payment defaults to the lenders thereunder, material inaccuracies of representations and warranties, covenant defaults, cross-defaults to other material indebtedness, voluntary and involuntary bankruptcy proceedings, material money judgments, pension-plan events reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect, certain change of control events and other customary events of default, subject to certain materiality levels, default triggers, cure and grace periods and/or baskets.

On the Solenis Acquisition Closing Date, we entered into our Term Loan Facility with Goldman Sachs Bank USA, as administrative agent and collateral agent, and certain other arrangers and lenders, which was fully drawn to fund, in part, the Solenis Acquisition. Thereafter, we also entered into an incremental amendment to the Term Loan Credit Agreement on April 6, 2022. As of the date of this offering memorandum approximately $1,938.0 million, subject to exchange rates, of term loans were outstanding under the Term Loan Facility, consisting of a $1,110.0 million Dollar tranche (the “Initial Dollar Term Loans”), a $300.0 million Dollar incremental tranche (the “2022 Incremental Term Loans”) and a €500.0 million Euro tranche. On the Acquisition Closing Date, we intend to enter into an amendment to the Term Loan Credit Agreement which, among other things, will provide for an incremental Dollar term loan tranche in an aggregate principal amount of approximately $750.0 million (“Incremental Term Loan”), which may be increased at our election up to an amount sufficient to fund certain original issue discount or upfront fees in respect. We expect to borrow the Incremental Term Loan in full in a single drawing on the Acquisition Closing Date, the proceeds of which will be used, together with other available proceeds, to, among other things, finance the Acquisition. Consistent with the existing Term Loan Facility, the Incremental Term Loan Facility will mature seven years after the Solenis Acquisition Closing Date and, although it is not fungible with the Initial Dollar Term Loans or the 2022 Incremental Term Loans for federal income tax purposes, will be subject to substantially the same terms and conditions as the existing Term Loan Facility, subject to certain exceptions including that (x) subject to certain exclusions, a 1.00% premium will be payable on any prepayment in connection with certain repricing transactions prior to the date that is six months after the Acquisition Closing Date and (y) subject to certain exclusions, the effective yield with respect to any syndicated, Dollar-denominated, incremental term loans incurred under the Term Loan Credit Agreement on or prior to the date that is six months after the Acquisition Closing Date, may not be more than 0.75% higher than the corresponding effective yield for the Incremental Term Loans unless the interest rate margins with respect to the Incremental Term Loan are increased by an amount equal to the difference between 211 ----- the effective yield with respect to such additional incremental term loans and the corresponding effective yield on the Incremental Term Loans minus 0.75%. Subject to certain conditions, our Term Loan Facility, without the consent of the then-existing lenders (but subject to the receipt of commitments), may be increased (or new incremental term loan facilities added) in an aggregate principal amount for all such increases, incremental facilities and certain incremental equivalent debt of no greater than (a) the greater of (x) $600.0 million and (y) 100.0% of Consolidated EBITDA (as such term is defined in the Term Loan Credit Agreement), minus (b) any amounts previously used pursuant to the basket in clause (a), plus (c) an amount equal to all voluntary prepayments, repurchases and redemptions of, among other things, pari passu term loans borrowed under the Term Loan Credit Agreement and certain other indebtedness, plus (d) an unlimited amount, so long as on a pro forma basis, either (1) the Consolidated First Lien Net Leverage Ratio (as such term is defined in the Term Loan Credit Agreement) either (x) would not exceed 5:10:1:00 or (y) at the election of the Issuer if incurred in connection with a permitted acquisition or other permitted investment, would not increase or (2) the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio (as such term is defined in the Term Loan Credit Agreement) is not less than the Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio prior to such increase. Our loans incurred under each Dollar-denominated tranche under the Term Loan Credit Agreement (including the Incremental Term Loans) amortize in equal quarterly installments in an amount equal to 1.00% per annum of the original principal amount of such tranche. The interest rate margin applicable to borrowings under the Dollar-denominated tranches of our Term Loan Facility is, at our option, either (1) the base rate (which is the highest of (x) the then-current federal funds rate set by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, plus 0.50%, (y) the prime rate on such day and (z) (i) with respect to the Initial Dollar Term Loans, the one-month LIBOR for a period commencing on such date plus 1.00% and (ii) with respect to the 2022 Incremental Term Loans and the Incremental Term Loans, the one-month Term SOFR for a period commencing on such date plus 1.00%) plus an applicable margin or (2) in the case of the Initial Dollar Term Loans, one-, three- or six-month LIBOR or, if agreed to by all lenders of LIBOR loans, 12-month LIBOR or any shorter period (selected at our option) plus an applicable margin, or in the case of the 2022 Incremental Term Loans and the Incremental Term Loans, one-, three- or six-month Term SOFR or, if agreed to by all lenders of Term SOFR loans, 12-month Term SOFR plus an applicable margin. The Initial Dollar Term Loans are subject to a LIBOR floor and the 2022 Incremental Term Loans and the Incremental Term Loans are subject to a Term SOFR floor. We expect to replace the LIBOR reference rate with respect to our Initial Dollar Term Loans with Term SOFR (which may be subject to a spread adjustment) in accordance with the terms of our Term Loan Credit Agreement on or prior to June 30, 2023. Our loans incurred under the Euro tranche of our Term Loan Facility do not have scheduled amortization payments prior to maturity. The interest rate margin applicable to borrowings under the Euro tranche of our Term Loan Facility is either one-, three- or six-month EURIBOR or, if agreed to by all relevant lenders, 12-month EURIBOR or any shorter period (selected at our option) plus an applicable margin. The Euro tranche under our Term Loan Facility is subject to a EURIBOR floor. We may voluntarily prepay loans under our Term Loan Facility, in whole or in part, subject to minimum amounts, with prior notice but without premium or penalty (other than with respect to certain prepayments of the Incremental Term Loans, as further detailed above). We are required to prepay our Term Loan Facility with the net cash proceeds of certain asset sales and casualty events relating to our assets (other than Current Asset Collateral), the incurrence or issuance of specified refinancing indebtedness or any indebtedness not permitted under the Term Loan Facility and 50% of excess cash flow, in each case, subject to certain reinvestment rights, thresholds, step-downs and other exceptions. Our obligations under our Term Loan Facility are guaranteed by Parent and its direct and indirect whollyowned U.S. subsidiaries (subject to certain customary exceptions, including exceptions based on immateriality thresholds of aggregate assets and revenues of excluded U.S. subsidiaries). Our Term Loan Facility is secured by a lien on substantially all of Issuer’s and each of the Term Loan Facility guarantors’ current and fixed assets (subject to certain exceptions), and our Term Loan Facility has a first-priority lien on the Fixed Asset Collateral and certain material real property and a second-priority lien on the Current Asset Collateral (second in priority to the liens securing our ABL Revolving Credit Facility discussed above), in each case, subject to other permitted liens. Our Term Loan Facility contains customary negative covenants generally consistent with those applicable to the Notes, including, but not limited to, restrictions on our ability and that of our restricted subsidiaries to merge 212 ----- and consolidate with other companies, incur indebtedness, grant liens or security interests on assets, make acquisitions, loans, advances or investments, pay dividends or other restricted payments, make investments, sell or otherwise transfer assets, optionally prepay or modify terms of certain junior indebtedness, enter into transactions with affiliates or certain burdensome agreements, modify our governing documents or certain junior debt documents or change our line of business. Our Term Loan Facility provides that, upon the occurrence of certain events of default, our obligations thereunder may be accelerated. Such events of default include payment defaults to the lenders thereunder, material inaccuracies of representations and warranties, covenant defaults, cross-defaults to other material indebtedness, voluntary and involuntary bankruptcy proceedings, unpaid material money judgments, pension-plan events reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect, change of control and other customary events of default subject to certain materiality levels, default triggers, cure and grace periods and or baskets.

Solenis Germany GmbH & Co. KG, Solenis Hispania, S.A.U., Solenis UK Limited, Solenis France SAS, Solenis Italia S.r.l., Solenis Canada ULC, Solenis Poland sp. z o.o. (each, an “Originator” and together, the “Originators”) and Solenis UK Industries Limited (the “Master Servicer” and the “Performance Guarantor”) have entered into a receivables purchase facility with ING Luxembourg S.A. (the “Purchaser,” and such facility, the “ING Accounts Receivable Facility”) pursuant to the terms of that certain Receivables Purchasing Agreement, dated as of March 26, 2018, (as amended and restated on September 30, 2019, March 18, 2020, March 21, 2022 and February 23, 2023 and as further amended, restated, amended and restated, modified and supplemented from time to time). Under the Accounts Receivables Facility upon satisfaction of conditions precedent, the Originators will periodically sell to the Purchaser up to an aggregate of EUR 110 million in eligible accounts receivable and certain related rights created in the ordinary course of business. The Master Servicer and the Originators, acting as servicers, service the purchased receivables on behalf of the Purchaser. The ING Accounts Receivable Facility will terminate on January 31, 2024, unless extended for additional one year periods or an earlier termination event occurs. Our performance obligations under the ING Accounts Receivable Facility are guaranteed by the Performance Guarantor. The following fees are applicable under the ING Accounts Receivable Facility: (a) an administrative fee of 0.05% per annum of EUR 110 million, payable monthly, (b) fees of (i) a funding cost equal to EURIBOR or the Compounded Reference Rate for USD, as applicable, plus an applicable margin, charged on the purchase price of a pool of purchase receivables for a given month and (ii) a commitment fee of 0.60% per annum of the unused portion of the ING Accounts Receivable Facility for the same period and (c) certain other customary fees and expenses incurred by the Purchaser. The ING Accounts Receivable Facility contains customary covenants, including, but not limited to, restrictions on the ability of the Master Servicer and the Originators to merge and consolidate with other companies, incur indebtedness, sell or otherwise transfer or grant liens or security interests on any purchased receivables other than in accordance with the ING Accounts Receivable Facility, and modify or fail to comply with their credit and collection policies. The ING Accounts Receivable Facility provides that, upon the occurrence of certain termination events, the Purchaser will cease to purchase new receivables, a backup servicer will assume the servicing duties of the Master Servicer, collections on the purchased receivables will be made on a daily basis and certain of our obligations thereunder may be accelerated. Such termination events include payment defaults, material inaccuracies of representations and warranties, covenant defaults, cross-defaults to other material indebtedness, voluntary and involuntary bankruptcy proceedings, change of control, failure to meet certain financial tests or maintain certain financial ratios and other customary termination events subject to certain materiality levels, default triggers, cure and grace periods. The terms and covenants discussed above may be amended or waived.

Subsubsection Title: Overview and Structure
Subsubsection Text: On October 1, 2021, the Issuer issued $815,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 4.250% Senior Secured Notes due 2028 (the “Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes”),€500,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 3.875% Senior Secured Notes due 2028 (the “Existing Euro Secured Notes” and together with the Existing 2028 Dollar 213 ----- Secured Notes, the “Existing 2028 Secured Notes”) and $400,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 6.250% Senior Notes due 2029 (the “Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes”) and €265,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 5.375% Senior Notes due 2029 (the “Existing Euro Unsecured Notes” and, (i) together with the Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes, the “Existing Unsecured Notes” and (ii) the Existing Unsecured Notes together with the Existing Euro Secured Notes, the “Existing Euro Notes”). On September 9, 2022, the Issuer issued $325,000,000 aggregate principal amount of 7.125% Senior Secured Notes due 2027 (the “Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes” and, (i) together with the Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes and the Existing Euro Secured Notes, the “Existing Secured Notes” and (ii) the Existing Secured Notes together with the Existing Unsecured Notes, the “Existing Notes”). The Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes and the Existing Euro Secured Notes mature on October 1, 2028, the Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes mature on October 1, 2027, the Existing Unsecured Notes mature on October 1, 2029, and, in each case, were issued in connection with the Solenis Acquisition. The Existing 2028 Secured Notes were issued pursuant to that certain indenture (the “Existing 2028 Secured Notes Indenture”) dated October 1, 2021, among the Issuer, the Guarantors named therein, the Trustee and the Notes Collateral Agent. The Existing Unsecured Notes were issued pursuant to that certain indenture (the “Existing Unsecured Notes Indenture”) dated October 1, 2021, among the Issuer, the Guarantors named therein and the Trustee. The Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes were issued pursuant to that certain indenture (the “Existing 2027 Secured Notes Indenture”) dated September 9, 2022, among the Issuer, the Guarantors named therein, the Trustee and the Notes Collateral Agent.

Subsubsection Title: Interest Rate
Subsubsection Text: The Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes accrue interest at 4.250% per annum. Interest on the Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes is payable in cash semi-annually in arrears on each April 1 and October 1. The Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes accrue interest at 7.125% per annum. Interest on the Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes is payable in cash semi-annually in arrears on each April 1 and October 1. The Existing Euro Secured Notes accrue interest at 3.875% per annum. Interest on the Existing Euro Secured Notes is payable in cash semi-annually in arrears on each April 1 and October 1. The Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes accrue interest at 6.250% per annum. Interest on the Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes is payable in cash semi-annually in arrears on each April 1 and October 1. The Existing Euro Unsecured Notes accrue interest at 5.375% per annum. Interest on the Existing Euro Unsecured Notes is payable in cash semi-annually in arrears on each April 1 and October 1.

Subsubsection Title: Payments and Redemptions
Subsubsection Text: At any time prior to October 1, 2024, the Issuer may redeem some or all of a series of Existing Notes at a price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the applicable series of Existing Notes, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the date of redemption, plus the “make-whole premium” applicable to such series of Existing Notes. At any time prior to October 1, 2024, the Issuer may redeem up to 40% of the principal amount of the Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes with the proceeds of certain equity offerings at a redemption price of 104.250% of the principal amount of the Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the date of redemption, so long as the lesser of (x) 50% of the aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes then outstanding and (y) $400.0 million aggregate principal amount of Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes remains outstanding (except to the extent all remaining Existing 2028 Dollar Secured Notes of such series are otherwise repurchased or redeemed at such time in accordance with the terms of the Existing 2028 Secured Notes Indenture). At any time prior to October 1, 2024, the Issuer may redeem up to 40% of the principal amount of the Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes with the proceeds of certain equity offerings at a redemption price of 107.125% of the principal amount of the Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the date of redemption, so long as the lesser of (x) 50% of the aggregate principal amount of the Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes then outstanding and (y) $100.0 million aggregate principal amount of Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes remains outstanding (except to the extent all remaining Existing 2027 Dollar Secured Notes of 214 ----- such series are otherwise repurchased or redeemed at such time in accordance with the terms of the Existing 2027 Secured Notes Indenture). At any time prior to October 1, 2024, the Issuer may redeem up to 40% of the principal amount of the Existing Euro Secured Notes with the proceeds of certain equity offerings at a redemption price of 103.875% of the principal amount of the Existing Euro Secured Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the date of redemption, so long as the lesser of (x) 50% of the aggregate principal amount of the Existing Euro Secured Notes then outstanding and (y) €250 million aggregate principal amount of Existing Euro Secured Notes remains outstanding (except to the extent all remaining Existing Euro Secured Notes of such series are otherwise repurchased or redeemed at such time in accordance with the terms of the Existing 2028 Secured Notes Indenture). At any time prior to October 1, 2024, the Issuer may redeem up to 40% of the principal amount of the Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes with the proceeds of certain equity offerings at a redemption price of 106.250% of the principal amount of the Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the date of redemption, so long as the lesser of (x) 50% of the aggregate principal amount of the Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes then outstanding and (y) $200.0 million aggregate principal amount of Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes remains outstanding (except to the extent all remaining Existing Dollar Unsecured Notes of such series are otherwise repurchased or redeemed at such time in accordance with the terms of the Existing Unsecured Notes Indenture). At any time prior to October 1, 2024, the Issuer may redeem up to 40% of the principal amount of the Existing Euro Unsecured Notes with the proceeds of certain equity offerings at a redemption price of 105.375% of the principal amount of the Existing Euro Unsecured Notes plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the date of redemption, so long as the lesser of (x) 50% of the aggregate principal amount of the Existing Euro Unsecured Notes then outstanding and (y) €130 million aggregate principal amount of Existing Euro Unsecured Notes remains outstanding (except to the extent all remaining Existing Euro Unsecured Notes of such series are otherwise repurchased or redeemed at such time in accordance with the terms of the Existing Unsecured Notes Indenture). At any time prior to October 1, 2024, the Issuer may redeem up to 10% of each series of Existing Secured Notes during each calendar year at a purchase price equal to 103% of the principal amount of such series of Existing Secured Notes redeemed, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but excluding, the redemption date. In connection with any offer to purchase a series of Existing Notes (including a change of control offer and any tender offer), if holders of no less than 90% of the aggregate principal amount of the applicable series of Existing Notes validly tender their Existing Notes, the Issuer is entitled to redeem any remaining Existing Notes of such series at the price offered to each holder. On or after October 1, 2024, the Issuer may on any one or more occasions redeem all or a portion of the Existing Notes at the redemption prices (expressed as percentages of principal amount of the applicable series of Existing Notes to be redeemed) set forth below, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, on such series of Existing Notes redeemed, to (but not including) the applicable date of redemption:

The Existing Unsecured Notes and the related guarantees are general, senior unsecured obligations of the Issuer and the Guarantors.

Subsubsection Title: Certain Covenants
Subsubsection Text: The Existing Indentures contains a number of covenants which, among other things, restrict, subject to certain exceptions our ability to: - incur additional indebtedness and guarantee indebtedness; - pay dividends or make other distributions in respect of, or repurchase or redeem, its capital stock; - prepay, redeem or repurchase certain debt; - issue certain preferred stock or similar equity securities; - make loans and investments; - sell assets; - incur liens; - enter into agreements containing prohibitions affecting its subsidiaries’ ability to pay dividends; - enter into transactions with affiliates; and - consolidate, merge or sell all or substantially all of its assets. These covenants will be subject to a number of important exceptions and qualifications. Certain covenants will cease to apply to the Existing Notes, if, and for so long as, the Existing Notes have investment grade ratings from certain rating agencies and there is no default or event of default under the applicable Existing Indenture.

The following summary of certain provisions of our Existing Notes, Credit Facilities and certain other indebtedness does not purport to be complete and may not contain all of the information that is important to you, and is subject to, and qualified in its entirety by reference to, all of the provisions of the corresponding agreements.

Subsubsection Title: The Notes
Subsubsection Text: If the Acquisition is not consummated on the Issue Date, prior to the Escrow Release (as defined below), the Notes will be senior secured obligations of the Escrow Issuer, as secured by the Escrowed Funds on a first priority basis. From and after the Escrow Release (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes concurrently with this offering), the Notes will be senior secured obligations of the Issuer and will: - be secured on a first-priority basis, equally and ratably with all Obligations of the Issuer under any other Parity Lien Indebtedness, by Liens on the Fixed Asset Collateral from time to time owned by the Issuer, subject to certain exceptions and Permitted Liens, as described under “—Security— Collateral,” “—Security—Intercreditor Arrangements,” “—Certain Covenants—Liens” and “— Certain Definitions—Permitted Liens”; - be secured on a second-priority basis, equally and ratably with all Obligations of the Issuer under any other Parity Lien Indebtedness, by Liens on the Current Asset Collateral from time to time owned by the Issuer, subject to certain exceptions and Permitted Liens (including Liens on the Current Asset Collateral securing any Priority Lien Obligations), as described under “— Security— Collateral,” “— Security—Intercreditor Arrangements,” “—Certain Covenants— Liens” and “—Certain Definitions— Permitted Liens”; - without giving effect to collateral arrangements, rank contractually equal in right of payment with all existing and future senior Indebtedness of the Issuer (including Indebtedness under the Credit Agreements, the Existing Secured Indentures and the Existing Unsecured Indenture); - rank contractually senior in right of payment to all future Subordinated Indebtedness of the Issuer, if any; - be effectively senior to any existing and future unsecured Indebtedness of the Issuer and Indebtedness secured by Liens junior to the Liens securing the Notes to the extent of the value of the Collateral (including, in the case of the Fixed Asset Collateral, the Obligations under the ABL Credit Agreement); - be effectively equal to any existing and future Parity Lien Indebtedness, including the Obligations under the Term Loan Credit Agreement and the Existing Secured Indentures; 219 ----- - be effectively subordinated to any existing and future Secured Indebtedness of the Issuer that is secured by Liens on assets that do not constitute Collateral to the extent of the value of the assets securing such Indebtedness; - be effectively subordinated to any existing and future Priority Lien Obligations of the Issuer (including Indebtedness under the ABL Credit Agreement to the extent of the value of the Current Asset Collateral securing such obligations); - be structurally subordinated to all existing and future liabilities of all Non-Guarantor Subsidiaries; and - be guaranteed on a senior secured basis by Parent and each Wholly Owned Subsidiary that guarantees any obligations under the Term Loan Credit Agreement. As described in this offering memorandum under “Capitalization,” as of March 31, 2023, on a pro forma basis after giving effect to the offering but before giving pro forma effect to the Acquisition, total indebtedness of $7,305 million (excluding letters of credit, performance guarantees and local lines of credit), including the Notes, the Existing Notes and borrowings under the Term Loan Credit Agreement and the ABL Credit Agreement, and we would have had unused commitments under our ABL Credit Agreement available to us of $640.0 million. In addition, under the Credit Agreements we have the option to raise incremental Indebtedness (including incremental term loans and incremental revolving commitments, as applicable), subject to certain terms and conditions. See “Description of Certain Indebtedness.” Certain of the operations of Parent will be conducted through its Subsidiaries (other than the Issuer). As a result, the Issuer will be dependent upon dividends and other payments from Parent’s Subsidiaries to generate the funds necessary to meet its outstanding Indebtedness service and other obligations, and such dividends and other payments may be restricted by law or the instruments governing the Indebtedness of Parent and its Subsidiaries. Parent’s Subsidiaries may not generate sufficient cash from operations to enable the Issuer to make some or all of the principal and interest payments on its Indebtedness, including the Notes. The Indenture will not be qualified under the TIA, and the TIA shall not apply to or in any way govern the terms of the Indenture. As a result, no provisions of the TIA will be incorporated into the Indenture unless expressly incorporated pursuant to this “Description of Notes.” The registered holder of a Note will be treated as the owner of it for all purposes. Only registered holders will have rights under the Indenture.

Subsubsection Title: Principal, Maturity and Interest
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer will issue $      billion aggregate principal amount of Dollar Notes and €      billion aggregate principal amount of Euro Notes in this offering. The Dollar Notes and the Euro Notes will constitute separate Series of Notes under the Indenture but, except as otherwise provided herein, will be treated as a single class for all purposes under the Indenture, including for purposes of voting and taking all other actions permitted by holders of the Notes. For purposes of calculating the aggregate principal amount of Notes that have consented to or voted in favor of any amendment, supplement or waiver, the U.S. dollar equivalent of the principal amount of the Euro Notes shall be calculated by the Issuer using the exchange rate as provided on the applicable Reuters screen (or such other services as may be selected by the Issuer in its discretion) at approximately 10:00 a.m. (New York City time) on the date that is two business days prior to the date of such amendment, supplement or waiver. The Notes will mature on November 15, 2028. Subject to compliance with the covenants described below under the caption “—Certain Covenants— Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Disqualified Stock or Preferred Stock,” and “—Certain Covenants— Liens,” the Issuer may issue additional Dollar Notes (“Additional Dollar Notes”) and additional Euro Notes (“Additional Euro Notes” and, together with Additional Dollar Notes, “Additional Notes”) from time to time after this offering under the Indenture. Except as otherwise specified, the Dollar Notes offered hereby and any Additional Dollar Notes subsequently issued under the Indenture shall be treated as a single class for all purposes under the Indenture, including waivers, amendments, redemptions and offers to purchase. Except as otherwise specified, the Euro Notes offered hereby and any Additional Euro Notes subsequently issued under the Indenture shall be treated as a single 220 ----- class for all purposes under the Indenture, including waivers, amendments, redemptions and offers to purchase. Holders of Additional Notes issued will share equally and ratably in the Collateral with the holders of the Notes issued prior thereto. Unless the context requires otherwise, references to “Notes” for all purposes of the Indenture and this “Description of Notes” include any Additional Notes that are issued. However, in order for any Additional Dollar Notes to have the same CUSIP number as the Dollar Notes initially issued on the Issue Date, such Additional Dollar Notes must be fungible with the initial Dollar Notes for U.S. federal income tax purposes, and in order for any Additional Euro Notes to have the same CUSIP number as the Euro Notes initially issued on the Issue Date, such Additional Euro Notes must be fungible with the initial Euro Notes for U.S. federal income tax purposes. Interest on the Dollar Notes will accrue at the rate of      % per annum. Interest on the Euro Notes will accrue at the rate of      % per annum. Interest on the Notes will accrue from the Issue Date or from the most recent date to which interest has been paid or provided for, payable semi-annually on April 1 and October 1 of each year (each such date, an “interest payment date”), commencing on October 1, 2023, to holders of record as of the close of business on March 15 or September 15 (whether or not a business day) immediately preceding each interest payment date. Interest will be paid on the basis of a 360-day year consisting of twelve 30-day months. The Dollar Notes will be issued in minimum denominations of $200,000 and integral multiples of $1,000 in excess thereof, and the Euro Notes will be issued in minimum denominations of €100,000 and integral multiples of €1,000 in excess thereof.

Subsubsection Title: Methods of Receiving Payments on the Notes
Subsubsection Text: All payments on the Dollar Notes will be made at the office or agency of the paying agent maintained for such purpose (the “Dollar Paying Agent”) ”) and (ii) the Euro Notes will be made at the office or agency of the paying agent maintained for such purpose (the “Euro Paying Agent” and, together with the Dollar Paying Agent, the “Paying Agents”), in each case, unless the Issuer elects to make interest payments due on an interest payment date by check mailed to the persons entitled thereto at their address set forth in the register of holders; provided that if a holder of Notes has given wire transfer instructions to the paying agent at least fifteen (15) business days prior to an interest payment date, the Issuer will pay all interest on that holder’s Notes due on an interest payment date in accordance with those instructions. All payments on global notes will be made in accordance with the applicable procedures of (i) The Depository Trust Company (“DTC”), in the case of the Dollar Notes, and (ii) Euroclear and/or Clearstream, in the case of the Euro Notes. Payments on the Notes will be made free and clear of any deduction or withholding for taxes, except as otherwise required by law.

Subsubsection Title: Paying Agents and Registrars for the Notes
Subsubsection Text: The initial Dollar Paying Agent and registrar for the Dollar Notes will be The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A. The initial Euro Paying Agent and registrar for the Euro Notes will be The Bank of New York Mellon, London Branch. The Issuer may change the paying agent or registrar without prior notice to the holders of the Notes, and the Issuer or any of its Subsidiaries may act as paying agent or registrar. If any Notes are listed on an exchange and the rules of such exchange so require, the Issuer will satisfy any requirement of such exchange as to paying agents, registrars and transfer agents and will comply with any notice requirements under such exchange in connection with any change of paying agent, registrar or transfer agent.

Subsubsection Title: Transfer and Exchange
Subsubsection Text: A holder may transfer or exchange Notes in accordance with the provisions of the Indenture. The registrar and the Trustee may require a holder, among other things, to furnish appropriate endorsements and transfer documents in connection with a transfer of Notes. Holders of the Notes will be required to pay all taxes due on transfer. The Issuer will not be required to transfer or exchange any Note selected for redemption, except the unredeemed portion of any Note being redeemed in part. Also, the Issuer will not be required to transfer or exchange any Note for a period of fifteen (15) days before a selection of Notes to be redeemed.

Subsubsection Title: Note Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: If the Acquisition Closing Date occurs after the Issue Date, the Notes will not be guaranteed initially. On the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), Parent and each of Parent’s Wholly Owned Subsidiaries that are Domestic Subsidiaries (other than Excluded Subsidiaries) that is a borrower and/or guarantor under the Term Loan Credit Agreement will jointly and severally, irrevocably, fully and unconditionally guarantee on a senior secured basis the performance and punctual payment when due, whether at 221 ----- Stated Maturity, by acceleration or otherwise, of all Obligations of the Issuer under the Indenture and the Notes (including interest, fees and expenses which, but for the filing of a petition in bankruptcy with respect to the Issuer, would have accrued on any Obligation, whether or not a claim is allowed against the Issuer for such interest, fees and expenses in the related bankruptcy proceeding) to the holders, the Notes Collateral Agent and the Trustee, whether for payment of principal or interest on the Notes, fees, expenses, indemnification or otherwise (all such obligations guaranteed by such Guarantors being herein called the “Secured Guaranteed Obligations”). Each Note Guarantee of a Guarantor will be a senior secured obligation of such Guarantor and will: - be secured on a first-priority basis, equally and ratably with all Obligations of such Guarantor under any other Parity Lien Indebtedness, by Liens on the Fixed Asset Collateral from time to time owned by such Guarantor, subject to certain exceptions and Permitted Liens, as described under “—Security— Collateral,” “—Security—Intercreditor Arrangements,” “—Certain Covenants— Liens” and “— Certain Definitions—Permitted Liens”; - be secured on a second-priority basis, equally and ratably with all Obligations of such Guarantor under any other Parity Lien Indebtedness, by Liens on the Current Asset Collateral from time to time owned by such Guarantor, subject to certain exceptions and Permitted Liens (including Liens on the Current Asset Collateral securing any Priority Lien Obligations), as described under “— Security—Collateral,” “—Security—Intercreditor Arrangements,” “—Certain Covenants— Liens” and “—Certain Definitions—Permitted Liens”; - without giving effect to collateral arrangements, rank contractually equal in right of payment with all existing and future senior Indebtedness of such Guarantor (including Indebtedness under the Existing Notes and the Credit Agreements); - rank contractually senior in right of payment to all existing and future Subordinated Indebtedness of such Guarantor, if any; - be effectively senior to any existing and future unsecured Indebtedness of the Issuer and Indebtedness secured by Liens junior to the Liens securing the Notes to the extent of the value of the Collateral (including, in the case of the Fixed Asset Collateral, the Obligations under the ABL Credit Agreement); - be effectively equal to any existing and future Parity Lien Indebtedness, including the Obligations under the Term Loan Credit Agreement and the Existing Secured Indentures; - be effectively subordinated to any existing and future Secured Indebtedness of the Issuer that is secured by Liens on assets that do not constitute Collateral to the extent of the value of the assets securing such Indebtedness; - be effectively subordinated to any existing and future Priority Lien Obligations of such Guarantor (including such Guarantor’s guarantee of Indebtedness under the ABL Credit Agreement), to the extent of the value of the Current Asset Collateral securing such Indebtedness; and - be structurally subordinated to all existing and future liabilities of such Guarantor’s NonGuarantor Subsidiaries. Each Note Guarantee will be limited in amount to an amount not to exceed the maximum amount that can be guaranteed by the applicable Guarantor without rendering the Indenture or the Note Guarantee, as it relates to such Guarantor, voidable under applicable law relating to fraudulent conveyance or fraudulent transfer or similar laws affecting the rights of creditors generally. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes and Our Indebtedness—Fraudulent transfer or fraudulent conveyance laws may permit a court to void the Notes and/or the guarantees thereof (or the related security interests with respect to the Notes) and, if that occurs, you may not receive any payments on the Notes.” After the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), the Issuer will cause each Restricted Subsidiary (unless such Subsidiary is an Excluded Subsidiary or is already a Guarantor) that is a guarantor or a borrower under the Term Loan Credit Agreement to 222 ----- execute and deliver to the Trustee a supplemental indenture (or to execute the Indenture to the extent the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), pursuant to which such Restricted Subsidiary will guarantee performance and payment of the Notes on the same senior secured basis. See “—Certain Covenants—Future Guarantees.” Each Note Guarantee will be a continuing guarantee and, subject to the next succeeding paragraph, shall: (1) remain in full force and effect until payment in full of all the Secured Guaranteed Obligations; (2) be binding upon each such Guarantor and its successors and assigns; and (3) inure to the benefit of and be enforceable by the Trustee, the Notes Collateral Agent, the holders and their successors, transferees and assigns. A Note Guarantee of a Subsidiary Guarantor will be automatically and unconditionally released and discharged upon: (a) the sale, exchange, disposition or other transfer (including through merger, consolidation, amalgamation, Division or dissolution) of the Capital Stock of such Subsidiary Guarantor to a Person that is not (either before or after giving effect to such transaction) Parent or any of its Restricted Subsidiaries, if after such transaction the Guarantor is no longer a Restricted Subsidiary, or (b) all or substantially all the assets of such Subsidiary Guarantor if such sale, exchange, disposition or other transfer (including through merger, consolidation, amalgamation, Division or dissolution) is made in compliance with the Indenture; (c) the Issuer designating such Subsidiary Guarantor to be an Unrestricted Subsidiary in accordance with the provisions set forth under “—Certain Covenants—Restricted Payments” and the definition of “Unrestricted Subsidiary”; (d) in the case of any Restricted Subsidiary that after the Acquisition Closing Date (or after the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), is required to guarantee the Notes pursuant to the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Future Guarantees,” the release or discharge of the Guarantee by such Subsidiary Guarantor of Indebtedness of the Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary or the repayment of the Indebtedness or Disqualified Stock, in each case, that resulted in the obligation to guarantee the Notes, except by reason of payment under or the termination or repayment of such Indebtedness or if a release or discharge is by or as a result of payment in connection with the enforcement of remedies under such other Guarantee or direct obligation; (e) the Issuer’s exercise of its legal defeasance option or covenant defeasance option as described under “—Legal Defeasance and Covenant Defeasance,” or if the Issuer’s Obligations under the Indenture are discharged (including pursuant to a satisfaction and discharge of the Indenture or through redemption or repurchase of all of the Notes or otherwise) in accordance with the terms of the Indenture; (f) the release or discharge of the Guarantee by, or direct obligation of, such Subsidiary Guarantor of the Obligations under the Term Loan Credit Agreement, except by reason of payment under or the termination or repayment of the Term Loan Credit Agreement or if such release or discharge is by or as a result of payment in connection with the enforcement of remedies under such Guarantee or direct obligation; (g) such Subsidiary Guarantor becoming an Excluded Subsidiary; (h) such Subsidiary Guarantor ceasing to be a Wholly Owned Subsidiary of Parent, including as a result of any foreclosure of any pledge or security interest securing Indebtedness or any exercise of remedies in respect thereof in accordance with the Intercreditor Agreements, as applicable; _provided that such Subsidiary Guarantor shall only be released if such Subsidiary became a non-_ Wholly Owned Subsidiary pursuant to a transaction where such Subsidiary becomes a bona fide joint venture where the other Person taking an equity interest in such Subsidiary is not an Affiliate of Parent (other than as a result of such joint venture); 223 ----- (i) as described in “—Certain Covenants—Changes in Covenants When Notes Rated Investment Grade”; or (j) as described under “—Amendment, Supplement and Waiver.” The Note Guarantee of Parent will be released if the Issuer exercises its legal defeasance option or covenant defeasance option as described under “—Legal Defeasance and Covenant Defeasance,” if the Issuer’s Obligations under the Indenture are discharged (including pursuant to a satisfaction and discharge of the Indenture as described below under “—Satisfaction and Discharge” or through redemption or repurchase of all the Notes or otherwise) in accordance with the terms of the Indenture or if there is a release or discharge of such Note Guarantee by, or direct obligation of, Parent of the Obligations under the Term Loan Credit Agreement, except by reason of payment under or the termination or repayment of the Term Loan Credit Agreement or a discharge or release by or as a result of payment in connection with the enforcement of remedies under such guarantee or direct obligation. Unless a Subsidiary is a Guarantor, claims of creditors of such Subsidiaries (including trade creditors) and claims of preferred stockholders (if any) of such Subsidiaries generally will have priority with respect to the assets and earnings of such Subsidiaries over the claims of creditors of the Issuer, including holders of the Notes. The Notes, therefore, will be structurally subordinated to claims of creditors (including trade creditors) and preferred stockholders (if any) of Non-Guarantor Subsidiaries. Although the Indenture will contain limitations on the amount of additional Indebtedness that Parent and certain of its Subsidiaries may incur, such limitations are subject to a number of significant exceptions. See “—Certain Covenants—Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Disqualified Stock or Preferred Stock” below. As of the Acquisition Closing Date (or as of the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), all of Parent’s Subsidiaries are expected to be “Restricted Subsidiaries.” However, under the circumstances described under “—Certain Covenants,” the Issuer will be permitted to designate certain of Parent’s Subsidiaries as “Unrestricted Subsidiaries.” The Unrestricted Subsidiaries will not be subject to the restrictive covenants in the Indenture and will not guarantee the Notes. On the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), each of Parent’s Subsidiaries (other than Excluded Subsidiaries) that is a borrower and/or guarantor under the Term Loan Credit Agreement will be a Guarantor. For the twelve months ended March 31, 2023, on a pro forma basis after giving effect to the offering, our non-Guarantor subsidiaries represented approximately 68% of our Net sales and approximately 63% of our Pro Forma Combined Adjusted EBITDA. As of March 31, 2023, after giving effect to the offering, our non-Guarantor subsidiaries represented approximately 60% of our total assets (excluding intercompany receivables and investments in subsidiaries) and approximately 43% of our total liabilities (excluding intercompany payables).

Subsubsection Title: Security
Subsubsection Text: _Collateral General_ If the Acquisition Closing Date occurs after the Issue Date, the Notes will be secured by the Escrow Account initially. On the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), the Notes and the Note Guarantees will be secured by Liens on the Collateral on an equal and ratable basis with all Parity Lien Obligations. These Liens will be senior in priority to the Liens securing all Priority Lien Obligations in respect of Fixed Asset Collateral and junior in priority to the Liens securing all Priority Lien Obligations in respect of Current Asset Collateral. The Liens on the Collateral that will secure the Notes and Note Guarantees will be granted under the Security Documents in favor of the Notes Collateral Agent for the benefit of itself, the holders of the Notes and the Trustee. The Liens on the Collateral that secure the Obligations under the Term Loan Credit Agreement (the “Term _Loan Obligations”) have been granted to the collateral agent under the Term Loan Credit Agreement (the “Term Loan Collateral Agent”) pursuant to separate security documentation. The Liens on the Collateral that secure the_ Obligations under the Existing Secured Notes have also been granted to the Existing Secured Notes Collateral Agents under the Existing Secured Indentures pursuant to separate security documentation. The relative rights among the creditors of the Term Loan Obligations and the holders of the other Parity Lien Obligations (including the holders of the Notes and the Existing Secured Notes) will be governed by the Pari Passu Intercreditor Agreement 224 ----- as set forth below under the caption “—Intercreditor Arrangements—Pari Passu Intercreditor Agreement.” The Liens on the Collateral that secure the Obligations under the ABL Credit Agreement (the “Priority Lien _Obligations”) have been granted to the collateral agent under the ABL Credit Agreement (the “ABL Collateral Agent”) pursuant to separate security documentation. The relative rights among the creditors of the Priority Lien_ Obligations, on the one hand, and the holders of the Parity Lien Obligations (including the holders of the Notes and the Existing Secured Notes and the lenders under the Term Loan Credit Agreement), on the other hand, will be governed by the ABL Intercreditor Agreement as described below under the caption “—Intercreditor Arrangements—ABL Intercreditor Agreement.” The Collateral comprises substantially all of the assets and property of the Issuer and the Guarantors, whether real, personal or mixed, other than the Excluded Assets and other than any assets released from the Collateral. The Collateral will exclude the following assets and property (“Excluded Assets”), including, without limitation: (1) (i) any fee-owned real property that (A) is located outside the United States, (B) has a fair market value equal to or less than $25.0 million or (C) contains improvements located in an area identified by the Federal Emergency Management Agency (or any successor agency) as a “special flood hazard area” and (ii) any real property leasehold interests; (2) interest in any contracts, permits, licenses, leases, Accounts, General Intangibles (other than any Equity Interests), Payment Intangibles, Chattel Paper, Letter-of-Credit Rights and Promissory Notes, if the grant of a security interest or Lien therein is prohibited as a matter of law, rule or regulation or under the terms of such contracts, permits, licenses, leases, Accounts, General Intangibles, Payment Intangibles, Chattel Paper, Letter-of-Credit Rights and Promissory Notes, in each case after giving effect to any applicable Uniform Commercial Code, other applicable law and principles of equity; (3) the voting Equity Interests of (i) any first tier Foreign Subsidiary that is a CFC in excess of 65% of the outstanding voting Equity Interests thereof and (ii) any FSHCO in excess of 65% of the outstanding voting Equity Interests thereof; (4) assets subject to Capital Lease Obligations, purchase money financing and cash to secure letter of credit reimbursement obligations to the extent such Capital Lease Obligations, purchase money financing or letters of credit are permitted under the Indenture and the terms thereof prohibit a grant of a security interest therein; (5) assets sold to a person who is not the Issuer or a Guarantor in compliance with the Indenture; (6) assets owned by a Subsidiary after the release of the guaranty of the Obligations of such Subsidiary pursuant to the Indenture and each other document evidencing Parity Lien Obligations; (7) any motor vehicles and any other goods subject to a certificate of title law of any state (to the extent a security interest therein cannot be perfected by a UCC filing); (8) any application for registration of a trademark filed with the PTO on an intent-to-use basis until such time (if any) as a statement of use or amendment to allege use is accepted by the PTO, at which time such trademark shall automatically become part of the Collateral and subject to the security interest of the Security Documents; (9) Equity Interests in any Person (i) other than the Issuer and Wholly Owned Subsidiaries to the extent a pledge thereof is not permitted by the terms of such Person’s charter documents or joint venture or shareholders agreements and other organizational documents and (ii) to the extent a pledge thereof is not permitted by any law, rule or regulation, in each case of clause (i) and (ii) after giving effect to Article 9 of the UCC and other applicable law; (10) any Letter-of-Credit Right (to the extent a security interest in such Letter-of-Credit Right cannot be perfected by a UCC filing) and any Commercial Tort Claim, in each case, with a value (as determined in good faith by Issuer) of less than $30,000,000; 225 ----- (11) assets to the extent the cost of obtaining a security interest or perfection thereof are excessive in relation to the benefits to the holders of the notes of the security afforded thereby as determined by the Issuer in good faith in writing delivered to the Notes Collateral Agent; (12) “margin stock” (within the meaning of Regulation U); (13) Excluded Accounts (other than any account included in such definition solely by virtue of being a zero balance account); (14) Equity Interests in Unrestricted Subsidiaries and Immaterial Subsidiaries; (15) certain segregated deposits that constitute Permitted Liens; and (16) any asset to the extent granting a security interest in such asset would result in a material adverse tax consequence to any Permitted Parent and/or its Subsidiaries, as reasonably determined in good faith by the Issuer and notified in writing to the Notes Collateral Agent; provided that this clause (16) shall not apply to any intercompany Indebtedness for borrowed money issued in connection with the Solenis Acquisition; _provided, however, that Excluded Assets will not include (a) any proceeds, substitutions or replacements of any_ Excluded Assets (except to the extent such proceeds, substitutions or replacements would themselves constitute Excluded Assets) or (b) any asset of the Issuer or the Guarantors that secures Obligations with respect to the ABL Credit Agreement or the Term Loan Credit Agreement; provided, further, that capitalized terms used in clauses (2) and (10) above and not otherwise defined herein shall have the meaning given to such term in the UCC as in effect on the date hereof in the State of New York. _Certain Limitations on the Collateral_ No appraisals of any of the Collateral have been prepared by or on behalf of the Issuer or any Guarantor in connection with the issuance and sale of the Notes. The value of the Collateral in the event of liquidation will depend on many factors. Consequently, liquidating the Collateral may not produce proceeds in an amount sufficient to pay any amounts due on the Notes. The Collateral securing our obligations under the Notes and the Note Guarantees is shared with other creditors. If there is a default, the value of the Collateral may not be sufficient to repay the creditors of Priority Lien Obligations and Parity Lien Obligations, including the holders of the Notes. The fair market value of the Collateral is subject to fluctuations based on a number of factors, including, among others, prevailing interest rates, the ability to sell the Collateral in an orderly sale, general economic conditions, the availability of buyers and similar factors. The amount to be received upon a sale of the Collateral will be dependent on numerous factors, including the actual fair market value of the Collateral at such time, the timing and the manner of the sale and the availability of buyers. By its nature, some of the Collateral may be illiquid and may have no readily ascertainable market value or market. In the event of a foreclosure, liquidation, bankruptcy, insolvency or similar proceeding, we cannot assure you that the proceeds from any sale or liquidation of the Collateral will be sufficient to pay the Issuer’s and the Guarantors’ Obligations in respect of the Notes and the Note Guarantees (after taking into account all of our other Indebtedness that is secured on all or any portion of the Collateral on a senior or pari passu basis). Any claim for the difference between the amount, if any, realized by holders of the Notes from the sale of Collateral securing the Notes and the Obligations in respect of the Notes and the Note Guarantees (after application of any proceeds of the Current Asset Collateral to the Priority Lien Obligations) will rank equally in right of payment with all of the Issuer’s and the Guarantors’ unsecured or undersecured senior Indebtedness and other unsubordinated Obligations, including the Existing Unsecured Notes and trade payables. To the extent that third parties establish Liens on the Collateral, such third parties could have rights and remedies with respect to the assets that, if exercised, could adversely affect the value of the Collateral or the ability of the Notes Collateral Agent or the holders to realize or foreclose on the Collateral. The Issuer may also issue Additional Notes after the Issue Date as described herein or otherwise incur Parity Lien Obligations or Priority Lien Obligations that would be secured by the Collateral, the effect of which would be to increase the amount of Indebtedness secured equally and ratably by the Collateral or secured on a priority basis with respect to the Current Asset Collateral. The ability of the holders to realize on the Collateral would also be subject to applicable bankruptcy law limitations in the event of a bankruptcy. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes and Our Indebtedness—The value of the Collateral securing the Notes may not be sufficient to satisfy our obligations under the Notes and the other obligations secured by an equal and ratable lien on the Collateral or a senior lien on the Current Asset Collateral.” _Release of Collateral_ 226 ----- The Issuer and the Guarantors are entitled to the releases of property and other assets included in the Collateral from the Liens securing the Notes under any one or more of the following circumstances: (1) in part, as to any property or assets constituting Collateral, to enable us to consummate the disposition of such property or assets (to a Person that is not the Issuer or a Guarantor) to the extent permitted under the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Merger, Consolidation or Sale of Assets”; (2) if such property becomes an Excluded Asset; (3) as to the property and assets of a Subsidiary Guarantor that is released from its Note Guarantee in accordance with the Indenture; (4) as described under “—Intercreditor Arrangements”; or (5) as described under “—Amendment, Supplement and Waiver” below. The security interests in all Collateral securing the Notes also will be released upon (i) payment in full of the principal of, together with accrued and unpaid interest and premium, if any, on, the Notes and all other Obligations with respect to the Notes under the Indenture, the Note Guarantees and the Security Documents that are due and payable at or prior to the time such principal, together with accrued and unpaid interest and premium, if any, are paid (including pursuant to a satisfaction and discharge of the Indenture as described below under “— Satisfaction and Discharge”) or (ii) a legal defeasance or covenant defeasance with respect to the Notes under the Indenture as described below under “—Legal Defeasance and Covenant Defeasance.” _Creation and Perfection of Certain Security Interests Post-Closing_ Certain mortgages with respect to the Collateral (including any related title insurance and surveys) may not be in place on the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date) or certain other security interests (including control agreements with respect to deposit accounts to the extent required hereunder) may not be created or perfected on the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date). See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes and Our Indebtedness— Security interests over certain of the Collateral may not be in place or perfected by the time the Notes are issued. Any issues that we are not able to resolve in connection with the granting of such security interests may impact the value of the Collateral. Creation or perfection of such security interests after the issuance of the Notes increases the risk that the liens granted by those security interests could be avoided in bankruptcy.” To the extent any such security interest could not be created or perfected or title insurance or surveys could not be obtained by such date, the Issuer and the Guarantors will agree to use their respective commercially reasonable efforts to do or cause to be done all acts and things that would be required to have all security interests in the Collateral duly created and enforceable and perfected, to the extent required by the Indenture or the Security Documents, and obtain title insurance and surveys within 90 days of the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date); _provided that the Issuer and Guarantors will enter into the Security Documents and file UCC financing statements_ on the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date). There will be no independent assurance prior to issuance of the Notes that all assets or properties contemplated to be mortgaged or pledged as security for the Notes will be mortgaged or pledged, or that we hold the real or personal property interests we represent we hold or that we may mortgage or pledge such interests, or that there will be no lien encumbering such real or personal property interests other than those permitted by the Indenture. Delivery of mortgages or other documents necessary to create or perfect security interests in other Collateral after the Issue Date increases the risk that the mortgages or other security interests could be avoidable in bankruptcy. Additionally, the Indenture and the security documents entered into in connection with the Notes will not require us to take a number of actions to perfect or to improve the perfection or priority of the liens of the Notes Collateral Agent for the benefit of itself, the holders of the Notes and the Trustee; provided that no control agreements with respect to deposit accounts and securities accounts shall be required (the “Perfection Exceptions”). Failure to create and perfect a security interest in the Collateral or to obtain title insurance, as required by the Indenture and the security documents entered into in connection with the Notes, within the required time period will constitute an Event of Default (as defined below) if and to the extent provided under clauses (3), (9) or (10) under the caption “—Events of Default and Remedies” below. Neither the Trustee nor the Notes Collateral Agent on behalf of the Trustee and the holders of the Notes has any duty or responsibility to see to or monitor the performance 227 ----- of Parent and its Subsidiaries with regard to these matters or to determine whether commercially reasonable efforts have been made by the Issuer. _Intercreditor Arrangements_ The Liens on the Collateral securing the Notes will be subject to two separate intercreditor agreements. On the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), the Notes Collateral Agent will enter into a joinder agreement to become a party to the Pari Passu Intercreditor Agreement to set forth its relative rights in the Collateral, which provides for the pari passu nature of their Liens, including any Liens that may, in the future, secure additional Parity Lien Indebtedness. In addition, on the Acquisition Closing Date (or on the Issue Date if the Acquisition closes on the Issue Date), the Notes Collateral Agent will, enter into a joinder agreement to become a party to the ABL Intercreditor Agreement, which governs the relative rights of the Liens on the Collateral in favor of the ABL Collateral Agent, the Term Loan Collateral Agent, the Existing Secured Notes Collateral Agents and the Notes Collateral Agent, and provides for the senior priority of the ABL Collateral Agent in the Current Asset Collateral relative to the Liens thereon of the Term Loan Collateral Agent, the Existing Secured Notes Collateral Agents, the Notes Collateral Agent and the representative of any other Parity Lien Indebtedness, and also provides for the senior priority of the Term Loan Collateral Agent, the Existing Secured Notes Collateral Agents and the Notes Collateral Agent in the Fixed Asset Collateral relative to the Liens thereon of the ABL Collateral Agent. If any other Indebtedness is designated as Parity Lien Indebtedness and is permitted by the terms of the Indenture to be secured by the Collateral, the representatives of the holders of such other Indebtedness will also become a party to the Pari Passu Intercreditor Agreement and the ABL Intercreditor Agreement. The Indenture provide that such intercreditor agreements may be amended from time to time without the consent of the holders of the Notes to, among other things, add other parties. Holders of the Notes will be deemed to have agreed and accepted the terms of the Pari Passu Intercreditor Agreement and the ABL Intercreditor Agreement and to have authorized and directed the Notes Collateral Agent (and Trustee, if applicable) to enter into and perform its obligations under the Intercreditor Agreements, binding the holders of the Notes to the terms thereof by their acceptance of the Notes. _Pari Passu Intercreditor Agreement_ Under the Pari Passu Intercreditor Agreement, only the “Controlling Collateral Agent” has the right to act or refrain from acting with respect to any Collateral. The Controlling Collateral Agent is initially the Term Loan Collateral Agent and will remain the Term Loan Collateral Agent until the earlier of (1) the discharge of Parity Lien Obligations that are Term Loan Obligations and (2) the Non-Controlling Collateral Agent Enforcement Date (such earlier date, the “Controlling Collateral Agent Change Date”). After the Controlling Collateral Agent Change Date, the Controlling Collateral Agent will be the authorized representative of the Series of Parity Lien Obligations that constitutes the largest outstanding aggregate principal amount of any then outstanding Series of Parity Lien Obligations (excluding the Series of Term Loan Obligations) with respect to such Collateral, but solely to the extent that such Series of Parity Lien Obligations has a larger aggregate principal amount than the Term Loan Obligations then outstanding (the “Major Non-Controlling Collateral Agent”); provided, however, that if there are two outstanding Series of Parity Lien Obligations which have an equal outstanding principal amount, the Series of Parity Lien Obligations with the earlier maturity date shall be considered to have the larger outstanding principal amount for purposes of this definition. With respect to any Collateral, no Non-Controlling Collateral Agent or other Non-Controlling Secured Party shall or shall instruct the Controlling Collateral Agent to, commence any judicial or nonjudicial foreclosure proceedings with respect to, seek to have a trustee, receiver, liquidator or similar official appointed for or over, attempt any action to take possession of, exercise any right, remedy or power with respect to, or otherwise take any action to enforce its security interest in or realize upon, or take any other action available to it in respect of, any Collateral. The “Non-Controlling Collateral Agent Enforcement Date” means, with respect to any Non-Controlling Collateral Agent, the date that is 180 days (throughout which 180-day period such Non-Controlling Collateral Agent was the Major Non-Controlling Collateral Agent) after the occurrence of both (a) an event of default, as defined in the indenture or other debt facility for the applicable Series of Parity Lien Obligations, and (b) the Controlling Collateral Agent and each other collateral agent’s receipt of written notice from such Non-Controlling Collateral Agent certifying that (i) such Non-Controlling Collateral Agent is the Major Non-Controlling Collateral Agent and 228 ----- that an event of default, as defined in the indenture or other debt facility for that Series of Parity Lien Obligations has occurred and is continuing and (ii) the Parity Lien Obligations of that Series are currently due and payable in full (whether as a result of acceleration thereof or otherwise) in accordance with the indenture or debt facility for that Series of Parity Lien Obligations;
